mav_sim.unit_tests.ch5_additional_tests module¶

This module provides some additional tests for chapter 5 that can be used to help you debug if you are not passing the unit tests

mav_sim.unit_tests.ch5_additional_tests.trim_objective_fun_helper() → None¶

This function seemingly does nothing. However, if you run it in debug mode, you should be able to check the function for intermediary values. You should get the following values:

desired_trim_state_dot (i.e., f_d):
[ [ 0. ]

[ 0. ] [-3.6807027 ] [ 0. ] [ 0. ] [ 0. ] [ 0. ] [ 0. ] [ 0.03721669] [ 0. ] [ 0. ] [ 0. ]]

forces_moment_vec:
[ [11351.99021794]

[ 78.46070672] [ -83.5720567 ] [ -176.13431905] [ -102.51488932] [ -94.78716552]]

f (dynamics based on current state and input):
[ [-6.43738031e+00]

[ 3.10095259e+00] [-5.09354767e+00] [ 1.02599911e+03] [ 1.91327915e+01] [-1.35974597e+01] [-1.00656326e+02] [ 4.09085613e-01] [-1.11846569e+02] [-3.12650814e+02] [ 1.31583354e+01] [-1.03745949e+02]]

delta (difference between desired and actual):
[ [ 6.43738031e+00]

[-3.10095259e+00] [ 1.41284497e+00] [-1.02599911e+03] [-1.91327915e+01] [ 1.35974597e+01] [ 1.00656326e+02] [-4.09085613e-01] [ 1.11883786e+02] [ 3.12650814e+02] [-1.31583354e+01] [ 1.03745949e+02]]

J (square of the difference): 13690027.487823917
